    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(@NonNull
                 Graphics2D gc,
                 @NonNull
                 ColoredImageCache imageCache,
                 int rowIndex)
        Draws the characters of the string onto the specified context.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context to draw with.
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve character images from.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate where the characters are to be drawn. Includes the first index and excludes the last index.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the gc or image cache is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the row index is below 0.

        Returns:

        public void checkRangeValidity(@NonNull
                               IntRange range)
        Determines whether or not the specified range is valid by throwing an exception if the range is invalid.
        Parameters:
        range - The range.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the start of the range is less than zero. If the end of the range is greater than the length of the string.

      • applyColorGradient

        public void applyColorGradient(@NonNull
                               Color colorFrom,
                               @NonNull
                               Color colorTo,
                               boolean applyToBackground)
        Applies a color gradient to the entire string.
        Parameters:
        colorFrom - The color to begin the gradient with.
        colorTo - The color to end the gradient with.
        applyToBackground - Whether or not to apply the gradient to the background or foreground of the characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the colorFrom or colorTo is null.

      • applyColorGradient

                               IntRange range,
                               @NonNull
                               Color colorFrom,
                               @NonNull
                               Color colorTo,
                               boolean applyToBackground)
        Applies a color gradient to a portion of the string.
        Parameters:
        range - The x-axis (column) coordinates of the characters to begin/end the gradient between. Includes the first index and excludes the last index.
        colorFrom - The color to begin the gradient with.
        colorTo - The color to end the gradient with.
        applyToBackground - Whether or not to apply the gradient to the background or foreground of the characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the rande, colorFrom, or colorTo is null.

      • enableBlinkEffect

        public void enableBlinkEffect(short millsBetweenBlinks,
                              @NonNull
                              com.valkryst.VRadio.Radio<String> radio)
        Enables the blink effect for every character.
        Parameters:
        millsBetweenBlinks - The amount of time, in milliseconds, before the blink effect can occur.
        radio - The Radio to transmit a DRAW event to whenever a blink occurs.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the radio is null.

                              @NonNull
                              com.valkryst.VRadio.Radio<String> radio,
                              @NonNull
                              IntRange range)
        Enables the blink effect for every character in the specified range.
        Parameters:
        millsBetweenBlinks - The amount of time, in milliseconds, before the blink effect can occur.
        radio - The Radio to transmit a DRAW event to whenever a blink occurs.
        range - The x-axis (column) coordinates of the characters to begin/end the change between. Includes the first index and excludes the last index.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the radio or range is null.

      • tintColors

        public void tintColors(double tintFactor,
                       boolean applyToBackground)
        Tints the either the foreground or background color, of every character, by some factor, where a higher factor results in a lighter tint.
        Parameters:
        tintFactor - The factor. Values should range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        applyToBackground - Whether or not to apply the tint to the background or foreground of the characters.

      • tintColors

        public void tintColors(@NonNull
                       IntRange range,
                       double tintFactor,
                       boolean applyToBackground)
        Tints either the foreground or background color, of every character in the specified range, by some factor, where a higher factor results in a lighter tint.
        Parameters:
        range - The x-axis (column) coordinates of the characters to begin/end the tint between. Includes the first index and excludes the last index.
        tintFactor - The factor. Values should range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        applyToBackground - Whether or not to apply the tint to the background or foreground of the characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the range is null.

      • shadeColors

                        boolean applyToBackground)
        Shades either the foreground or background color, of every character, by some factor, where a higher factor results in a darker shade.
        Parameters:
        shadeFactor - The factor. Values should range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        applyToBackground - Whether or not to apply the shade to the background or foreground of the characters.
